snippet: The federal Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration said Monday that it would seek a $3.7 million fine from the pipeline operator Enbridge over a 2010 oil spill.
abstract: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration says that it will seek a $3.7 million fine, a record civil penalty, from the pipeline operator Enbridge over a 2010 oil spill in the Kalamazoo River in Michigan.
lead_paragraph: The federal Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration said Monday that it would seek a $3.7 million fine from the pipeline operator Enbridge over a 2010 oil spill.
